title: The Plantiful Table: Easy, From-the-Earth Recipes for the Whole Family
features: Over 125 full-flavored, plant-based dishes sure to please even the pickiest kids and the hungriest adults

For food and lifestyle blogger Andrea Duclos (known as Drea to her friends and followers), “the good life” is a natural, plant-based one. But when she sits down with her husband and their young daughter, what’s on the menu? The quick-to-make, tasty creations in
Comfort classics made vegan, such as Mac & Cheese and Shepherd’s Pie
Comfort classics made vegan, such as
A world tour of flavors, from Garam Masala Pancakes to Bánh Mì Chay
A world tour of flavors, from
Pea Pesto, Mushrooms with Crispy Sage, and other amazing “things on toast”
Hearty one-pot dishes, festive Latin American fare, chocolaty treats, smoothies, and more!
Hearty one-pot dishes, festive Latin American fare, chocolaty treats, smoothies, and more!
This sunny, down-to-earth cookbook is proof that eating vegan

mean taking options off the table. Throughout, Drea gives kid-friendly tips so that one meal can feed everyone. Plus, she takes the guesswork out of reviving leftovers. So, from Drea’s family to yours—large or small, all-vegan or not—here are hearty meals straight from the earth, perfect for your happy home, every day!
description: One of Amazon’s Best Books of the Month in Cookbooks, Food & Wine
“Not too fussy or overly complicated, the recipes are inspired by the plant-based way Duclos eats and feeds her 5-year-old daughter, Marlowe.”—
“Drea’s dedication to a natural home and healthy living is passionate and contagious. Her story is real and her voice honest.”
“The dishes . . . are ideal for both children and omnivores yet sophisticated enough for an adults-table-only soiree.”—
“Whether you’re a dedicated omnivore or can’t live without a burger, this book has recipes that can be enjoyed by every palate.”—
“Andrea Duclos dishes up family-friendly meals that are wholesome and comforting”—

“Not only are Andrea Duclos’s introductory words kind, patient, and engaging, her helpful, sweet presence is intertwined throughout the entire cookbook. Duclos’s approach to healthy eating is attainable and inviting. She transforms traditionally heavy dishes into light, refreshing options—while preserving the tasty integrity of their original versions. My favorite part about

is its variety in cuisines. With inspiring flavors from Japan to Latin America, these recipes will definitely entertain the palate. Whether you’re looking for vegan meal ideas or simply looking to cook more wholesomely for the family, this cookbook is a delight.” —

is a beautifully crafted book filled with approachable meal ideas for vegan and vegetable-loving families. Andrea is a modern-day earth mama and her voice is warm and welcoming. Picking up this book makes you feel as though you’re at her family table.” —

and creator of the blog Cupcakes and Kale “With fun and inventive recipes like Hearts of Palm Patties and Indian Mango Pizza, Andrea Duclos shows us that plant-based eating can be something the whole family can get on board with (including the dog!).
is a must for those looking to bring their family together to share healthy, hearty plant-based meals!” —
But I Could Never Go Vegan!

is a fantastic book to get the entire family excited about healthy eating and dipping your toe into more whole-food recipes. Drea’s love for being a mother and mother earth shines through each recipe!” —
